FuncDef:
The increase-priority command increases the priority of the redirection action configured in the MF classification.
The undo increase-priority command cancels the increased priority of the redirection action configured in the MF classification.
By default, if traffic matches the QPPB, MF classification, and BGP FlowSpec rules simultaneously and the actions are redirection, the redirection action takes effect based on the BGP FlowSpec service.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If traffic matches the QPPB, MF classification, and BGP FlowSpec rules simultaneously and the actions are redirection, you can run this command to make the redirection action take effect based on the MF classification service.
